com.esri.mo2.data.feat
Interface DataListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
DataAdapter
public interface DataListener
extends EventListener

Implements a DataListener and supporting methods. A DataListener will be notified by a MapDataset object during the progress of certain "asynchronous" data building activities, such as retrieval of data from a remote server, or, when building spatial indices locally. For retrievals from an ArcIMS FeatureServer, a special event will be signalled when groups of retrievals are completed. ArcIMS FeatureServer groups data retrievals for a particular visited area (Tile), and arranges to ensure that newData() and completed() events are signalled only when all retrievals for that event type have been completed.

See Also:
MapDataset, FeatureServer

Method Detail

begun

public void begun(DataEvent e)
Invoked when the given asynchronous actvity commences.

Parameters:
e - the data event which specifies the type of activity

newData

public void newData(DataEvent e)
Invoked when new data added to the Dataset is ready to be accessed. Once this method has been invoked, outside code can obtain the new data from the Dataset.

Parameters:
e - the data event, it includes an Envelope of the new data

completed

public void completed(DataEvent e)
Invoked when the given asynchronous actvity is completed.

Parameters:
e - the data event

cancelled

public void cancelled(DataEvent e)
Invoked when the specified asynchronous actvity has been cancelled.

Parameters:
e - the data event

grouped

public void grouped(DataEvent e)
Invoked when an ArcIMS FeatureServer calls the newData method for a grouped retrieval. Only the last MapDataset in the group will signal this event. This signal allows the Map to redraw just once, rather than for every call to newData.

Parameters:
e - the data event
